## Checklist

<!-- Mark completed items with an "x" -->

### Code Quality

- [ ] My code follows the project's code style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings or errors
- [ ] I have run `cargo clippy` and addressed all warnings
- [ ] I have run `cargo fmt` to format the code

### Testing

- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested on multiple platforms (if applicable):
  - [ ] Windows
  - [ ] Linux
  - [ ] macOS

### Documentation

- [ ] I have updated the documentation (docs/src/) to reflect my changes
- [ ] I have updated the README.md (if needed)
- [ ] I have added/updated code comments and doc strings
- [ ] I have updated CHANGELOG.md (if applicable)

### Build Systems

If your changes affect build system integration, verify:

- [ ] CMake projects still work correctly
- [ ] XMake projects still work correctly
- [ ] Meson projects still work correctly
- [ ] Make projects still work correctly
- [ ] Custom build systems still work correctly

### Dependencies

- [ ] I have verified that no new vulnerabilities are introduced
- [ ] I have updated Cargo.toml (if dependencies changed)
- [ ] I have run `cargo update` and tested with updated dependencies

### Compatibility

- [ ] My changes maintain backward compatibility
- [ ] If breaking changes exist, I have documented them clearly
- [ ] I have updated version numbers appropriately (following semantic versioning)

### Examples

- [ ] I have updated or added examples demonstrating new features
- [ ] All examples still run correctly after my changes
